review: Was not staying there and once again ate at the restaurant with three guests. Was put to shame by the speed of the service which marred an otherwise very good selection on the menu. One of my guests was served with the wrong food and got no apology from the manager. We spent over two and a half hours, most of it waiting and each one of us had only ordered a two course meal and two of us had vegetarian dishes. We had to find the waiter to settle the bill.  This was not even a busy night.  For those with better luck- order food the minute you sit down and expect a long wait.
title: Speed of service needs attention in Artisan Main restaurant

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Spent a few nights here and loved everything about this hotel. The rooms are chic and comfortable. Staff is amazingly helpful. Wifi is free. You are within walking distance to shops and restaurants and the hotel feels overall safe. There is a business centre if you need to do work, as well as a restaurant on the 1st floor. The rooftop bar/pool is a great place to relax at the end of the day.  The small touches (as other reviewers have mentioned) are what make the stay extra special. You will get Kenyan animals made of soapstone every night - a very special touch.  Java House (in the Sarit center) is great for coffee and food. The Sarit center also has an ATM and grocery store - all very cheap.  Definitely would recommend this place!
title: Amazing stay!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: The hotel is very nice and peaceful. The room was very comfortable and large. The staff was efficient and courteous. I left my Kindle in the room, and the hotel kept it for me .... it was returned safely to me while on Safari in the Mara. The restaurants serve delicious food. I picked up a few good souvenirs from the in house boutique.
title: Very Good Experience

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I have stayed at the Sankara 3 times over the past several months for business. There is never a question of where I will stay in Nairobi because of the excellent and helpful service of this dedicated and friendly staff. The hotel is conveniently located. Serene and comfortable rooms (especially on 2nd floor, overlooking the pool next door), very good business facilities, and excellent food (insane dessert bar, lovely cold drinks). From reception to rooftop the hotel is well appointed and comfortable. But what really makes the Sankara special is the staff -  always professional, accommodating and eager to help. On one occasion, my colleagues and I had a 3 a.m. departure, and the staff arranged breakfast to go for us. On another, our trip was extended, and the staff did their
title: Excellent all the way

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: I loved my stay at the Sankara

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stayed in the Sankara for a few nights (5th Aug 13) and absolutely loved the hotel! The decor, the restaurants, the champagne bar on the roof, and the food. The little touches as well made me smile, the hotel gave me a new soapstone animal (lion, giraffe etc) every day which I thought was the nicest gift I've ever had from a hotel....a really nice touch!! The staff were lovely, and very elegant. Clearly alot of thought has gone into the detail of this hotel, and when I go back to Nairobi, this is where I'll stay. Everyone should feel very proud to be part of a really special place to stay.   I hope you enjoy it as much as me, Adam (UK)
title: Excellent, Revitalizing And Serene

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Sankara represents the best ambiance you can get in any one place in Westlands.  The lounge and bar have an excellent selection of drinks and an excellent relaxation.  Very good chill out place. The wine list is formidable with exotic Italian wines.  Service is also very good with knowledgeable and helpful staff.    Sankara is close to three  major shopping malls and will give you ease of enjoying shopping in the city and westlands in particular. parking is also readily available in the area.
title: Beyond Expectations

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: My visit to Sankara was amazing.  The nightly turn down service with soapstone animal figurines was an very welcoming touch.  The bellmen were extremely helpful and went of their way to help me.  The location was very convenient; a very short jaunt across the street to Sarit Center or a block or two from Westlands mall.  The fitness facility was well equipped for a quick vacation workout.  Water was bottled and readily available in whatever quantity you require.  I would stay here again if I ever get the chance to visit Nairobi again.
title: A real Gem of a business hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I wanted to stay for a longer period but it was full for the first four night I wanted but was very pleased I moved to the Sankara for the last four days of my visit. Rooms are reasonably spacious and was pleased how light the room was so was able to work in the room.  I had a room on the club floor so use of the club lounge which was convenient when I need a snack and to get out of the room for a while.  Resturant on the seventh floor was pleaseant for a change ut sugest you book a table as certainly at the weekend was very popular though the friendly staff managed to fit me in.  It is easy to access a number of malls in the area though of course the terrible events of Saturday 21st September occuring just a few days after I left was a  real shock.  Security at the hotel was
title: Four night business stay

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Quality place to stay.

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This turned out to be a decent location near the Sarit Center and the Undugu Fair Trade Shop. The room was very nice though perhaps a little cramped for the price and level of the hotel. The bathroom was very nice and included an in-room hair dryer, shower with multiple heads, and separate tub.  The spa included a nice fitness room, and the rooftop pool and bar was definitely picturesque. We enjoyed the lunch buffet at Artisan, the less formal of the restaurants within the hotel, with great Kenyan tea, great breads, soups, and cheeses among the options - plus an awesome dessert bar. The food service was incredibly friendly and helpful, and the outdoor patio for dining was lovely.  Hotel service was outstanding, including the front desk/reception and the director of services
title: Upmarket

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Great Place in CBD

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: My first impression of the hotel was wow! Very upmarket and trendy. The service was good although it felt a little commercial for me. The rooms were smart but rather small, given the price of $300 USD per night. The food was excellent, I ate breakfast and dinner at the restaurant. I recommend the view from the roof as its quite something. I would recommend this if your looking for real upmarket living.
title: Great Business Hotel...

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Good hotel, west lands location so if peak hours of traffic, ie 7am to 10 am and 4pm to 8pm, expect horrendous traffic to get to hotel from airport.  Nice hotel, nice food, and good location when no traffic.  Not the hotels fault re traffic... just something to take into consideration in case staying a night in nbo due to masai mara, like we did in November this year.  Alternative hotel near hotel and very nice is ole sereni which is recommended to stay or kill some hours like we did from wilson (to masai mara) to international airport.
title: Good hotel in nbo where 5star hotels are scarce

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: great hotel in nairobi. clean, very good service. room well equipped, W-Lan available all around the hotel.  restaurants and breakfast outstanding. no charge for any extras. airport transportation is working well.
title: great Hotel in Noirobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I thoroughly enjoyed the roof top dining.  The food was great and the staff was extremely accommodating.  The vast wine selection from South Africa, France, and Spain added to the dining experience immensely!
title: Roof Top Dining

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Nice staff and service, large room with all you need. Spa is very good for massages despite European prices it is good after a long trip. Swimming pool on the rooftop is nice but you are exposed to all the roof terrace cafe guests which is not the nicest if you want to just relax. Only remark from a very demanding guest, the rooms are not spotless spotless with stains on the carpet, lamp in bad shape. Otherwise I do recommend!
title: Good business hotel in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: From the minute of my Late arrival I was treated like a special guest. The room had a fantastic view of Nairobi City that I never expected and was spotless and cleaned at least twice a day. The food was absolutely gorgeous, from Sundays brunch time buffets to evening dinners. The staff were very attentive and knew my name within the first few Days of being there. Parking was available for me Regardless the time of the day or night  and nothing seemed any trouble to make my stay a good one. The bars were Fantastic and a good retreat for a drink in the evening as well as taking advantage of the big TV Screeners at the bars to watch my favorite soccer games while enjoying my drinks. I stayed at Sankara Hotel for two complete months and I proudly can say it is the best, based on my
title: Abdulkadir Abdalla Said

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: In the heart of Westlands is a GEM that is magnificent.  Great Food,  Excellent Rooftop lounge for those evening sun downers.  If you're in the mood for just a glass of wine you have a wide selection of wines from South Africa,  France and Spain.
title: Sankara Sanka

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I've stayed in a bunch of hotels, and I haven't seen anything that can match Sankara. From the elegance, to the cleanliness and friendly level of service (they even changed the beds in my room at my request with a smile), to the rooftop bar from which you see the whole of Westlands plus, to the initial welcome when you first get dropped off, to the breakfast quality, there was nothing about Sankara that didn't blow me away.
title: Unparalleled

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This is a relatively new hotel. The rooms and the facilities are very good. The staff is courteous.   The hotel is in the market area, so there are a few eating joints nearby. The west gate mall is also not too far. If you need to travel to main business zone around westlands, it is more convenient that Intercontinental.
title: Good Hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stayed in Sankara Hotel in September 2013, and really enjoyed the experience.  The hotel is very well situated, within the Westlands Area.  The room was extremely comfortable and spacious.  the food at the Sankara is lovely and really tasty.  They have a good selection for breakfast and the service was exceptional.  My only complaint was that for the club rooms you have to checkin on the 7th floor, so you have to drag your luggage to the 7th floor when you arrive and when you checkout.  I would defenitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to this side of Nairobi.
title: Lovely Sankara

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Recently used the conference facility and few things to improve on -they should never advertise on ground floor which company has conference on the day as I think it's not good for all public to know -service from staff needs a lot of improvements as staff morals are questionable and the zeal with which they serve -my guests who were from overseas for a meeting were charged for the conference arranged by us and it was very embarrassing when I came to know that my guests were charged It was a very important deal and the guest felt as if I was too cheap till I had to ask hotel to sort  Worst was that no senior person came to apologize though got refund back but damage was not repair able with my customers
title: Comments on conference facility

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: We recently made two brief stays at the Sankara, just a few days apart. The two stays felt so incredibly different, you would think we were in two different hotels.  For our first visit, my husband and I arrived at the Sankara very late on a Saturday evening after over 18 hours of travel from NYC. Our first impression was great. Very tight but friendly security, front desk clerk was efficient and welcoming. We received an upgrade. Room on the second floor. Nice bathroom.   Very clean. Cozy bed. Room service was ordered - a veg burger and a beef burger. Both arrived after about 45 min, and were quite tasty. We stayed 2 nights (Saturday and Sunday) and enjoyed a truly excellent Indian meal in the downstairs restaurant on our final evening as well as drinks on the rooftop lounge.
title: A tale of two VERY different hotels

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Good hotel, but with problems

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: If you're in Nairobi for business, then priority-one should be picking a hotel near your business.  Otherwise expect to spend a long, long time in standstill traffic (dodging khat-chewing matatu drivers).  You can easily spend an hour or two getting to JKIA from the Sankara Hotel during rush hour, or 45 minutes to downtown Nairobi.  The hotel was cozy and comfortable with a small gym, spa, pool, and a couple restaurants.  The beds were comfortable, and the linens felt soft, however the in-room entertainment was very limited.  Our bathrooms had both showers and tubs, which was definitely welcome.  The small animal carvings they left in the room each night during turn-down was a nice touch.  The main restaurant has a good buffet with several meat selections, however it wasn't
title: Very comfortable hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: New York Chique in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: An oasis of comfort in the city. The roof top pool with a window to the pavement is quite unique. Very friendly and helpful staff. Security is taken seriously which is good. I'll be back!The cost is high, but not easy to find really good hotels.
title: Business Hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Sankara  is a lovely place to stay.  Rooms are comfortable, reasonably spacious and quite comfortable and a good size bathroom with both shower and bathtub.    Breakfast is buffet style but a very large selection of foods.  Staff are very friendly and helpful.   The only complaint I have is the price of drinks . A glass of wine will cost you in the region of USD. 10 and that is for half a glass....  Will come back and can recommend to anybody to stay.
title: Very comfortable place to stay

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Nairobi is a beautiful and ugly place all at the same time.  I loved it!  But if you've got to stay there stay at the Sankara.  This is an oasis.  The rooms are incredibly comfortable and well furnished.  The bathrooms are nicely done as well.  I even loved their hygiene products.  Had room service and the food was delicious!  The breakfast was a little strange for me.  But I chalk that up to my limited African travel.  Everyone else in my party was happy with the breakfast choices.  My room was higher up in the hotel so I had a wonderful view.  The hotel staff was knowledgeable and very friendly and helpful as well.    The hotel restaurant and bar on the top floor has some great late night food and the pool there adds some really nice atmosphere at night.  Plus the view up
title: Stay here

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Excellent stay and great service

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This Hotel offers you a great stay with all the needed extras. The staff is very friendly and service is very good. Security is good but discrete.  Located very centrally giving you the opportunity to see parts of Nairobi. Somewhat high priced.
title: Nice Hotel in Hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I been to this palace in month of June 2011, its really nice hotel, Staff is very friendly and helpful, Food is also good, Like to visit again. Like the interior of the hotel is really nice and "WOW" Sea Food is very good in this hotel.
title: Excellent

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: The service, comfort, quality, location and food make this the ‘hotel of choice’ when we travel to Nairobi.   I have used this hotel various times and strongly recommend it.   The design if the hotel is modern (designed for business persons) and the attention to detail is top rate.  The hotel is very safe and a good location for Nairobi.  The breakfast buffet is excellent and they have is a special coffee shop called The Gallery (1st floor) where Jesse won the International Coffee Award.   Do get a cup of Kenya coffee from Jesse while there.  Overall Excellent.
title: The Best Hotel In Nairobi - Hands Down - 5 stars

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: On business in Nairobi and went for dinner at the Sankara Hotel's Savour restaurant. FANTASTIC! My colleagues had the buffet which was brilliant. The variety and choice was excellent. I had the Kenyaen Experience, which consists of two courses.   Starter was a magnificent tuna, mango and avo tartar, and for mains I choose the cow liver and toasted bruschetta. Both very yummy.   Would definitely be back.
title: Amazing!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: We spend our wedding night at Sankara and we are happy we did! A perfect welcome, the room was very welcoming with roses, rose petals all over, wine and sweets. A very nice room, well equipped and comfortable. Great bathroom. An excellent breakfast and a nice hostess in the Champagne Bar. My only wish is that they could have a restaurant open until later even though they have 24 hour room-service
title: The perfect wedding night

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This was my first trip to Africa.. Sankara was recommended to us by a friend who lives in nairobi so we booked it.. Honestly things weren't looking quite great as we covered the distance from airport to the hotel but i was amazed to see this newly constructed five star hotel in the middle of the city.. Sarit centre was just a 5 min walk away from the hotel which is a decent shopping mall...   Check in: this was quick as we had booked prior to going there  Room: the room was clean and decent size with some room to walk around.. Bathroom was also good size and detached from room by a glass wall which made the whole place look bright and big..  Food: breakfast has regular items and fresh fruits that i personally enjoy..  Thai Restaurant:  the hotel had a thai restaurant(a la card)
title: Loved the hotel..nice, clean and peaceful place to stay in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Sankara Hotel, A City Within a city in the sun

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I've stayed at many upmarket hotels in Nairobi over the years but, I've found my new favorite. Check in was smooth, the staff remembered your name and preference from news papers to milk with your coffee, rooms well laid out with work desk, nice amenities such as bath robes that you would really wear, bath products of excellent quality the kind I buy in shops in New York also the breakfast buffet included in room price was delicious with interesting selections including Lamb sausage and real fresh juices, pineapple and mint, carrot and ginger just to name a few.  The hotel is a short 2 min walk too main shopping malls and some of the best restaurants in westlands, so check out sankara when your in Nairobi.  Date of my stay, December 13/15 2013
title: Don't look any further.

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: we stayed there for 3 nights. it was very clean, the staff was very friendly, and the breakfast buffet was great. but it was overprice. we thought it was 170 $ but we had to pay a lot of taxes so the price was per night 220$ per night and this was way to mutch
title: very nice but expensive

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I have used this hotel many times, and I'm still a fan. The rooms are well presented, great linen and very clean. The hotel offers great restaurants with a good variety of food. Absolutely love the champagne bar and the spa on the top floor.
title: Fantastic business hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I found Sankara , Nairobi to be the best place in the heart of Nairobi, Excellent cuisine with comfortable rooms with very courteous staff are the value added when staying in this hotel.  You are also secure in your stay with your personal belongings as all the lifts have access cards to the floor you stay.  All Malls are nearby. SO shopping is very easy.  In addition they arrange tours to all Safari Parks at competitive rates.  In short a lovely place to be in.
title: The Best Place  in Heart of Nairobi City

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stayed there for 2 days in November 2013. The hotel was what you would expect for this standard. Rooms were of a good size, modern, clean and had good facilities. The only small issue I would have with the hotel is dining options are a little limited. The choices were a run of the mill Asian restaurant or a more expensive buffet.
title: Fine hotel for business travellers.

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: A very nice hotel in central Nairobi, with great rooms and all the modern facilities that the traveler could want or need for. Breakfast is a real treat with a wide variety at the buffet.  I have to make special mention of an outstanding member of staff at the rooftop pool bar…barman Randy.  Randy is a real gem of a character and made our stay at the Sankara very, very memorable!  He mixes a great Whisky Sour (ask for the special Drambue and ‘iceball’ version) and we spent every evening until the ‘wee hours’ enjoying his hospitality at the bar!  Will definitely be returning on our next visit to Kenya!
title: Barman Randy at the Pool Bar

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: From walking in to walking out I had no complaints , food good service great Gym good. The staff  should be commended on their service ethos which reflects on the management of the hotel. The really nice touch are the figures left on your pillow instead of chocolates 'class'
title: Great Hotel, Great staff

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I have been travelling to Nairobi since 1998 and have stayed at many hotels in the city. This is by far the best. Its modern and finished to an excellent standard. The rooms have free wifi, flat screen TV, mini bar, air conditioning and huge comfortable beds. There is just nothing to fault. Check in was a pleasure and there was a nice welcome bowl of fruit in the room to greet me. The decor is superb throughout the hotel and its finished to a very high standard. Breakfast is a splendid buffet and you can choose to sit inside or outside. The price is about the same as many of the other hotels and this one knocks spots off them so I would highly recommend it.
title: Exceptional hotel. Makes the rest look shabby.

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: It was just an amazing hotel!! Very clean and the staff was very nice! The chef was great and prepared good food. The rooms were nice and clean and I loved the modern feel with the bathroom. The pool was amazing, with a nice view of the city in the infinity pool! I had a great time!
title: Amazing!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Good hotel and very executive modern rooms. their breakfast has variety and menu is comprehensive. Unfortunately, I think they shall need to work on the staff especially in the restaurant and Housekeeping. Thy seemed to be unhappy and not really motivated. A good place, Just improve service delivery.
title: Nice

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I always try to get to my destinations through a skyteam flight (I take my elite status very seriously), so when I had to book a flight from Maputo to India, it was only normal that I would fly KQ, which meant I had to do a layover of 23 hours in Nairobi. The next step was to book a hotel, which at first I was very sceptical, going through some of the reviews on bookers or even on trip advisor, non of them seemed to get my attention, some looked outdated, tired or with a lot of personality (too colonial). I knew I would be tired so I looked for something modern, with clean lines and an appealing bed (of course .. from the photos).  The Shankara caught my attention and I booked a room for the night. It was everything that I was expecting. Clean, young, cool, high-tech, swanky but
title: Confortable layover

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: One of the nicest hotels in Nairobi, spoilt by rubbish internet

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I would have written that this is the most modern, well appointed hotel in Nairobi (that I've stayed in) with excellent facilities, in a good location (westlands) and top class service at a pretty reasonable price, however this place lets itself down by having a bewildering internet system that regularly logs you out and doesn't allow certain programs to run properly, such as ms outlook which became tiresome. Everything else about the hotel is excellent; the restaurant offers a good selection of food even though the buffet isn't that exciting. There are also several good spots for hanging out and a quality coffee/sandwich bar. I'd fully recommend this place once they sort out their internet, or if having internet access is less of an issue than it was for me, being on business.
title: Getting Scared before I get there

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I made calls through the website for a booking into this hotel, for my planned stay between the 28th and 2nd May. The lady I spoke too seemed to be friendly and helpful, but was sharing prices different from what I had seen on the website.  She promised to confirm my booking, but 48hrs later, I have not received a confirmation despite my repeated inquiries.  Still wondering if they are worth my money!  Dennis
title: Wonderful

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stayed at this hotel before and after my Safari. The hotel is very nice, spotlessly clean with top notch service. Food was great and rooftop bar was a great place to hang out. The hotel is well located in the Westlands area of nairobi. It is walking distance to may shopping areas including a mall with large supermarket (The Sarit Centre) literally across the street from the hotel. The staff was very accommodating even when I wanted to have my hair braided, they helped me to find a salon and negotiate the price.  One point of improvement: We had requested and prepaid for a room with 3 beds a month before stay. The room wasn't set up when we checked in at 4:00pm. We would have liked a ready room with 3 sets of towels and 3 beds ready before we arrive. This was quickly fixed by
title: wonderful experience

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Not the cheapest option, but a good choice if you can afford it. The public spaces are beautifully decorated, breakfast is excellent, service is consistently good, and the rooms are comfortably furnished. I also appreciated the friendly but thorough security and the good food at all the dining places in the hotel, notably the open-air area surrounding the pool up on the 7th floor. Other positives are the Sarit Mall next door, with supermarket and good gift store (stop by the Banana Box for all your souvenirs) and the nearby Mediterranean Restaurant. I must note, however, that the rooms (including drawers and closet space) are smallish -- fine for one person, but perhaps a little snug for two.
title: Style and comfort in Westlands

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Had a waiter grab the menu off my hands and couldn't let me order at all... only to later find out that he's the Bar manager at the Gallery. Never have I seen such a rude manager to a customer. They have good food and a nice selection of Wines and Whiskeys though! Better be ready to deal with rude staff from top to bottom in their chain!!
title: Crappy service

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Before I write this review, let me say I travel the world on business and stay in many hotels, my family have lived in Kenya most of their lives and have been in the travel industry running safaris.  I recently had two clients staying at the Sankara, I will not be recommending it to anyone in the future.  This hotel could be anywhere in the world, there is no Kenya love in this hotel, it is just a big clinical box with standard as per rooms. The security staff on the front door were by far the friendliest, reception staff were not particularly helpful and my clients had to ask to zoo the manager a number of times as the staff were unable to deal with the issue. They tried over charging and generally messed the booking around, even attempted to say they had no rooms at the
title: Clinical, unfriendly and no Kenya love

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: A bit overpriced !!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: My first stay at this hotel. On checking in late at night after a very long flight I was shocked to hear that my suit case needed  to be opened right in the lobby (albeit on the side) for security check.   To my surprise the staff was rummaging through my clothes and other personal things with BARE hands ! This  is just incredible and unacceptable !.  Had they put on disposable gloves I would definitely not have any problem.  It is for my own security that searches are carried out on everybody.  Apart from this unwelcome incident the hotel is fine.  The room was clean. The personnel were courteous.  Breakfast ok.  Meals were on the high side. The gym was wll equipped.  The room rate was somehow high compared to other hotels in town centre.  It is OK for a short business trip
title: Very nice sanctuary in the city

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: We stayed in this hotel two nights (not consecutive) and had positive experiences both times.  The staff if friendly, although had a little trouble understanding English.  I was traveling with a friend (another woman) and we had requested two bed.  After sending us to two different rooms (both with one king bed), we finally gave up and slept in the same bed.  The bed was large and comfortable, so really not a problem! We arrived late the first night, and were able to get room service - one of the best Indian meals I've eaten. The location is good, although traffic can be bad in Nairobi at any time of day.  We did not have trouble getting to the airport, as long as we allowed enough time.
title: Luxury in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I'd give this 4.5 stars if I could. But since I can't its a 4, not quite enough for 5!  The rooms were excellent, clean, large and comfortable. Fresh flowers and fruit as well as travel toothpaste and shaver give it that little extra touch. Security is good, there are metal detectors and bags are checked as well. The restaurant was good and breakfast was quite satisfactory (although not the best I have had). The rooms come with bath and shower and most seem to have a good view (for Nairobi).  No complaints but for 5 stars I would have liked a larger TV, slightly better breakfast and a newer mattress. Nothing to complain about though.   I do want to point out that it is advertised as a 5 star hotel. To me it more felt like a good 4 star with a some extra touches.   Overall this
title: One of the best in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Gotta love the Sankara.

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This was my first stay at the Sankara.  Like others, I arrives late, had a cry friendly, efficient check in, and nice assistance to my room.  The room was lovely, clean with a nice closet/wardrobe with a safe, ironing board and iron, and really nice clothes hangers.  There was a space to lay out luggage in addition to a separate luggage wrack ( nice for couples).  The bed was big and comfy.  I really likes the bedside lamp and separate reading light.  The desk space was great with three plug outlets and a good overhead lamp.  Plus it was next to the window/balcony.  The staff were all very nice and very accommodating.  Yes, the traffic is a challenge, but hey!  Welcome to Nairobi!  The decor is sort of Modern Africa, and I like it a lot.  I will definitely come back to this
title: the best, nothing to say about it

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Perfectly Comfortable

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: For years I've been staying at the Serena or the Intercontinental when on business in Nairobi but wanted to try the Sankara because I'd heard so many good things about it. And it is an excellent, world class hotel. It is modern, sleek, functional, with a solid lounge and restaurant selection and by far the best trained hotel staff I've come across in Kenya.   However, the gym is simply not up to international business hotel standards. It is almost an afterthought in a hotel where everything else from the decor to the service is world class. For serious business travelers like myself who spend up to six months a year on the road the exercise facilities are often the most important thing I am looking for in a hotel after price and location. The Sankara gym is small, has a very
title: Great Business Hotel in Nairobi but....

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Sankara is beautiful, but beware the slooooow Internet WiFi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: The Sankara property itself is beautiful, clean, and well maintained ... and the restaurant selections and Club Lounge service are very very good.  The rooftop bar and pool are truly first rate.  BUT, beware that the WiFi internet connections are severely throttled ... both in the Lobby area and individual rooms ... such that even common e-mail connections are slow slow slooooow.  By the time you're able to connect with your VPN or gmail account, you'll likely get timed out again and again.  The WiFi is free ... but the bandwidth is simply ridiculous ... a complaint shared the entire week of our stay by several of my business colleagues also staying at the Sankara.  It's a shame that such a beautiful and service-friendly property has such limited and frustrating IT connectivity.
title: Beatiful Roof Top Pool Side Restaurant...!!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Been there with all my colleagues for dinner in Jan 14, I liked the ambiance, preferably to go with your Beau/Spouse, service was quick and food quality was good. Would definitely like to visit again.
title: Very nice rooms and ambience

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I was in Nairobi over the weekend of 21 September for the Safari Sevens. Most people would remember that was the weekend of the bomb attack in Westlands and Sankara is a few kilometers away.  However, we comfortably continued with our trip throughout.  The staff from the front desk, to the restaurants, to the pool side bar, everywhere were fantastic and hospitable. The rooms are nice, airy and comfortable.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  The only two challenges I had were with security - they are neither the most polite nor the most subtle when deciding who is a security risk; and the smoking areas are either on 7th or 2nd floor and I was on 4th floor.    The incident I had with security was reported and was promptly and professionally dealt with
title: Good quality business hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Stayed a while ago, but enjoyed it. I stayed in a suite style room with a lovely bathroom. The buffet restaurant on the mezzo floor was excellent.   The only complaints were the water patches on the walls (probably plumbing issues) and having to go through a metal detector. Although when it comes to security I guess its better to be safe than sorry.
title: Probably the most high tech hotel in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: The Sankara hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in in Africa. The rooms are very clean and stuff are very friendly and professional. I enjoyed my very short stay there. The bar on the top floor has a good view of Nairobi too.
title: Value for Money

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Loved my short stay at the Sankarahotel whilst in Nairobi. It's located in the Westlands area and is a short walk away from some good restaurants and bars. Great food, especially the dinner buffet. Check out the heated pool. Staff are really friendly and welcoming and the rooms are spacious and have all the amenities you could ask for. Would definitely visit again.
title: Great Hotel in Nairobi in a good area.

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Sankara penthouse is the right choice for a business meeting mostly morning time.  Good view, good selection of beverages, chill - out music and great comfortable sofas. And don't forget from the lobby to the pool area everything is so posh and stylish.  Just enjoy then!
title: Right place

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stayed here for about 10 days on work travel. It was an ideal location since our office is in Westlands and I could walk. The hotel is really nice. The rooms are great and have all the amenities one would expect. The rooftop bar and pool are also great place to relax. There are a few restaurants in the hotel as well. I only ate there a couple times, but the food was good. They also have a small gym which was appreciated. I sadly didn't get to check out the spa but heard it's great. Even though it's a very nice hotel, you pay for it. I'm not sure what prices are like at other hotels in Nairobi, but this one caters to business people. I think if here for vacation one could search around a bit and find something slightly less fancy for a better rate.
title: Very Nice but Pricey

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This hotel has pretty much everything you need in terms of room amenities and general facilities, and everything is in excellent condition and quality and so on. So I will not go through all that. I would, however, like to mention the staff who were very friendly and helpful with all kinds of matters at all times during my week at Sankara. Yes, all this comes with a rather high price. But I found that it was worth what I got during my stay!
title: Outstanding service

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Located in the centre of Nairobi, perfect for access to markets and about 30 minutes from the airport when the roads aren't choked by traffic - as they usually are in Nairobi. Great restaurants and a fantastic view of Nairobi from the roof pool bar and restaurant.
title: Great service from excellent staff

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I would say this hotel has every thing as a business traveller.... Well appointed room,sleek and great in room amenities.  The sleep is very comfortable, lovely bed and you barely hear any noise from busy street.  Well though and build well....
title: Great Modern and well equipped hotel @ heart of Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Had to stay in Hotel for a week for business, was great . Had a clubroom that gives you access to a private business conference facilities etc. service were great! Staff extremely kind and helpful. Will go back every time. Food just magnificent.
title: Great business stay

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: We usually eat up at the pool side on the roof top and have never had a bad experience. Of late, the menu has changed and is even better, offering a lot more dishes for the individual palette. They have delicious vegetable juices that are freshly made and not watered down like a some places do. Their gazpacho soup is to die for too! Only problem is that it is a popular smoking haunt and sheesh is also widely available, therefore for a non=smoker, it is very difficult to find a smoke free zone.
title: Delicious and lovely

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I was recently in Nairobi on business in May 2014 and stayed at the Sankara upon the advice of a colleague. I can only say positive things about my experience. The hotel staff were friendly and highly professional. My room was tastefully decorated and very comfortable. A very cute touch was the little big 5 animal stone figurines that they leave on your night table (way better than a chocolate). I dined at the rooftop pool restaurant for dinner and lunch. The menu was simple and offered a wide selection of beverages. The hotel was very accommodating with changes made by my fellow business travelers. They were also great in helping us arrange local car transportation. I truly enjoyed my stay and look forward to coming back one day again.
title: Absolutely Fabulous

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Extremely friendly staff, comfortable beds,  that will always be my home when visiting Nairobi . The hotel is not in the best parts of the city but a very big up to the fact that when you get inside the hotel , you totally forget and think you are in some upmarket suburb.   The Seven Sankara collection....., it's brilliant keeps one wandering what's next.   Keep it up
title: Pleasant stay

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: My third stay at the Sankara, and it has maintained its high standards.   Excellent service, attentive, intelligent and friendly, from all hotel staff.  Upmarket taxis on standby throughout the day.  Well equipped modern rooms.  Decent restaurant and bar, with good food, small terrace area at the restaurant and rooftop at the bar, with nice views.    Pool and gym are not huge but both are pleasant.  Its unashamedly a business hotel - unlike some other Nairobi hotels, it has no extensive grounds or public spaces, its in a busy and unattractive area in Westlands near the CBD, it has no grand history.   But in a city with lots of accommodation choices and generally good service, Sankara stands out.
title: Superbly businesslike

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stay at the Sankara Nairobi on a regular basis for Business and there's a lot of good to be said abou the hotel, location and staff.  The resturants, food and service is generally good but at times can be slow in coming.  The rooftop bar is a lively place most nights and agains suffers from slow service when there is anything bigger that an small crowd.  My observation and reason for writing this review relates to Guest Services, in particular transportation services provided by the hotel.  Now for those who know Nairobi it can be a congented and dangerous place to visit and having access to comfortable and safe transportation to navigate the City is a must.   After arriving in Nairobi recently I was greeted by deshevelled driver who was driving an equally described vehicle
title: Poor Guest Services

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Sankara Pool Bar Happy Hour

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Two day stay at the Sankara while on business in Nairobi. Pleasantly surprised at the standard of the hotel, the staff were exceptional equivalent or better than many 5 star Hotels I have stayed in. The bed- was exceptionally comfortable and room well appointed for the business traveller.   Breakfast buffet catered to all tastes the highlight being freshly made Kenyan coffee, a great start to the day.   Would highly recommend for business travel.
title: Pleasant stay, great staff

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: it was worth my money, th gus at the pool bar were the best, they served me according to how i wanted. They have spacious, air-conditioned rooms all feature elegant, contemporary décor, a flat-screen TV, free Wi-Fi and tea-and-coffee making facilities which make you feel at home but mine didn't have a bath tab, their bed are cosy and well spread. if you have an occassion they are ever read y to put to your taste.  The gym is awesome, i wish to go back again may be during this march
title: Exquisite service

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: The service and friendliness of the staff is first class. Food on the hotel also very good and the facilities great. Awesome rooftop bar! But...it is clearly taking advantage of expats and business travellers and NOT value for money... Sadly
title: Good hotel...but is it value for money

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Spent time at the wine bar on the 7th floor in a Friday in February 2014 with friends. Pricy! The customer service was superb; real Kenyan hospitality - the only thing that makes the place special (for me). Oh, the band was quiet 'engaging' as well.
title: Exquisite service.

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: For the cost, the Sankara falls way short. The staff at the pool are slow and indignant. I stayed there twice in the last month. My first room was well taken care of. The second was barely cleaned each day and required a couple of calls to maintenance upon arrival. The breakfasts are disorganized, it's practically impossible to get your toast, eggs and bacon all warm and on the plate at the same time. Service is slow. The tea is ALWAYS lukewarm no matter where you order it. I could go on but you get the picture.   My wallet was stolen while by the pool in the afternoon. While this is not the hotel's fault and they were very concerned and understanding about it, just be aware of your surroundings and your stuff.
title: Not worth the money

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Due to our leaving Kenya and packing up our house, we stayed one night at Sankara and were most impressed with the well appointed interconnecting room for our family.  The rooftop champagne bar is a great meeting place regardless if you stay at the hotel - it has a very cool vibe.  The brunch/lunch offered in the hotel restaurant is also outstanding. We have been to this brunch many times and believe it to be the best in Nairobi ... unlimited sparkling wine and very good food. Great for the kids as well. Wonderful service all round. Highly recommend if you need accommodation in Nairobi and for locals, a definite must for Sunday brunch!
title: Stylish hotel in central location

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Excellent rooms and attentive staff when asked directly for help.  Breakfast service very good and caters for broad range of tastes.  It is important to check when booking where you will be going in terms of location.  For example, the Upper Hill Road Area where there are many international offices is a good 50 minutes drive in rush hour.
title: Hard to fault

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Great hotel, nice rooms, and a very swanky hotel. However it comes into it's own on a Saturday night, when the Nairobi Set come out to play. Over dress for this, as you will still feel under-dressed when you arrive. The best location of this hotel is the roof, at night, sun downers over the city with friends.
title: See Nairobi's IT set

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I used to stay at other Nairobi hotels, but decided to try out the Sankara this time and loved the experience must say! The rooms are nicely decorated and very suited for especially business travellers (I stayed on the Club Lounge Floors so I don't know if it's the same for all rooms, but you have an ironing board&iron for example which is great). Due to business dinners/lunches outside the hotel I unfortunately never had the chance to taste the hotel's dishes, but I did like the breakfast (either at the Club Lounge on the 7th floor or in the main restaurant) and the afternoon tea and happy hour snacks. The gym is well equiped and what I particularly liked -travelling a lot for work so I would dare to say I can compare to similar hotels- is that the gym staff is really there to
title: First time at the Sankara, most likely not the last!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Decent, not 5 star though

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: The Sankara is a good hotel.   Things we liked:  - the rooms are very nice, clean and the wifi works well.  - the breakfast is great. the food in the restaurants is good also, but lack atmosphere in the evening.  - the staff are very helpful.   Things we didnt like: - we stayed over a weekend and it was VERY NOISY in the corridors. We didnt complain, but in hindsight we should have. - when you use the taxi company afiliated to the hotel, which is very professional, BUT be aware of WAITING TIME. we never asked the taxi to wait for us whilst we were at the mall and subsequently he tries to charge us for this. we of course didnt pay this, but we had to argue about it.  - once we checked out of the hotel, you cannot access the free wifi. When i requested access i was told i had to
title: Good but not great!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Pretty Normal for 5 Star Hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: We stayed at the Sankara in June 2014 for 5 nights. I was with my two young children. The staff were nice and helpful. The food in the restaurants was great. But the service in the restaurant was not very good. Every meal I had to get up to find our waitress (which is tricky to do with a toddler!). The room was beautiful and very clean. The cleaning staff are good but slow, so make sure you give them at least 4 hours to clean your room. The location is nice, near a mall so you can easily walk to do shopping.  The pool is really for decoration, as it is in the middle of the bar upstairs so people are eating and watching you swim, just a little uncomfortable. We didn't want to take the kids to swim because it just didn't seem like a family place. But over all we were happy with
title: Very Underwhelming!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Great Hotel, Professional Staff

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I have written a review on Sankara before and I guess things have changed since then. We went for dinner because it was recommended for having the best burgers in town. First, the staff told us that we had to pay for WiFi.I was completely shocked! This was the first time I was asked to pay for WiFi anywhere! This is supposed to be a five star hotel for heavens sake! Even small restaurants and cafes in town do not ask me to pay for WiFi. The burger was not that great and after spending a lot of money for dinner, all I can say is am very disappointed. I am not giving you one star because of the ambiance.Word of advice , make sure you have your on way of accessing the internet when you go there!
title: Wonderful Hotel - you won't be disappointed

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: nice room, excellent service, nice restaurant, pool is very small and too cold to swim in - they should have it indoors instead, wifi connection was free but was very patchy and slow. the taxi service is safe and very convenient.
title: good hotel for Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: The Sankara is a top quality business hotel in the heart of Nairobi. The usual suspects of international travellers - Intercontinental and Hilton in Nairobi are disasters in comparison. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, service is prompt and the food is excellent. The roof top restaurant and bar is great - with a pool and a crooner in the evenings.
title: excellent business hotel choice

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This is an amazing hotel. I was here for 5 weeks for business, and was originally going to stay at the Intercontinental, but after reading reviews on trip advisor I decided to look for alternatives. Purely by luck I found the Sankara. The rooms are beautiful, luxurious and modern. The staff are very helpful, the gym is modern. Room service is good and the roof top bar is pretty nice way to chill out after day in the office.
title: What of the best hotels I have stayed at

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stayed at hotel for one week in June 2014. Friendly and serviceminded staff. I used their car service (very good) to and from Airport. Hotel has several good reataurants. Pool is very small and located on high floor.
title: Good business hotel and excellent breakfast

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I have stayed a few times at the Sankara and recently added club rooms with access to the lounge.  After a day in seriously congested Nairobi, the Sankara feels like home away from home.  Modern and relax at the same time.  Service and food are excellent.  If you you are bored about hotel food you have top Indian and Chinese food around the corner.  Rooms are modern and cleaned.  Bathrooms are top notch with strong showers and modern amenities.  You want a nice bar then the bar by the pool on the 7th floor is worth a visit.  Gym is small but well equipped. I just moved to my new home and on my way out I was given a nice gift with all sorts do food to keep my alive for a few days.
title: Best business hotel in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: My wife and I spent nearly eight weeks at the Sankara, from 13th May, whilst working in Kenya. It is a very modern hotel, I think about three years old, with beautifully appointed rooms. Both the guest rooms and the public areas were always beautifully clean, and the food was always excellent. Its greatest strength is its staff, from the manager down, who could not have been kinder and more attentive to our needs. The only drawback to the hotel is its lack of outdoor space for sitting and relaxing. The security was impressive in these difficult times in Kenya, but was delivered with smiles to minimise the impact on the guests. Over the long period of our stay, it progressively felt like home. There is also a desk where the staff are very helpful in organising leisure activities,
title: Sankara Hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Nice hotel but not quite 5 star

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: We stayed at the Sankara for 3 nights on a recent long weekend trip to Nairobi with our 2 kids (age 4 and 2) (we are currently living in Africa).  The location was good near the central business district and right next door to a mall which was helpful for the food court, grocery store, etc if you need anything.  The hotel itself was very nice, with a comfortable room with a nice lush king bed and nicely decorated.  We had asked for 2 queen or double beds explaining that we wanted a bed for our 4 year old and one for us.  When we showed up it was a room with two twin beds in it - clearly that wouldn't work.  They were quick to move us to a King room without a problem and our 4 year old ended up sleeping in an additional pack and play (which came about an hour after they said it
title: Party!!! Pool Side

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: 5 Star Service

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I visited Sankara for a Business/Project party at Top Floor Pool Side. It was an awesome weather, lovely staff and great food.  Its is a swanky hotel in the heart of the city. It was the best place/restaurant in the Nairobi. Good thing is that we got the veg food easily. :)  After having the food we walked up to the Gypsies bar.
title: very impressive!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Exceeded our expectataions , we used this venue in August 2013 and then again in June2014, will be back again, awesome staff , always willing to help. Grace(event co-ordinator) is always willing to go the extra mile, nothing too hard to sort. Clean, beautiful venue, Will be back on holiday
title: Fabulous Hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I spent two nights in this hotel during June 2014, the service and food were at the expected standard, the hotel team is extremely friendly and keen to help. The gym is reasonable sized and equipped although needs new machines. The pool restaurant is worth visiting. The hotel feels safe and they are very active in security.
title: Relaxing and Safe

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Excelent service, very good and well furnished rooms, quality amenities and delicious breakfast.  There is only one suggestion I would give to the hotel, regarding to menu option. They should have simple plates, like grilled fish with vegetables. All they have include souces and spicies.
title: Excelent hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stayed at the Sankara Nairobi for two nights in July 2014 while on business and found the hotel to be excellent in terms of location and amenities offered.  Relative to other hotels in the area that I have stayed at in the past, the Sankara was problem-free.  The rooms were modern and clean and the staff at the hotel were particularly helpful and willing to accommodate any request - for me, this included a few extra hours in the room after checkout since my departing flight was very late at night.  The restaurant was excellent for breakfast and dinner and was able to easily accommodate a large group I was with.  I will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Nairobi.
title: Great hotel for business

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Stayed at Sankara for a holiday. Very nice business  hotel but not much African feel. No outdoor space which would make it more relaxing and rooftop pool not very relaxing as in bar area.  Nice breakfast and coffee bar. Very helpful person (Emma) on the travel desk,
title: Good business hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I booked this hotel online, and it seems they go out of their way to present online rates as lower, when they end up being higher. Breakfast, which is normally included, is not if you book online. They charge nearly USD 30 per day for breakfast, which is good but quite basic.  Otherwise, the hotel is nice. The staff is extremely friendly.  Rooms are clean, but with a few signs of wear. Wifi is decent.
title: Far too many extra charges

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I have stayed at the Sankara at least 3 times in the last year, and each time the experience has been very good.  Have also used their chaffeur service to and from the Airport.  The beds are very comfortable and more importantly free and fairly fast wi-fi available.  The bar on the roof is really a nice place to relax after a days work and the gym is nice , with 2 treadmills, 2 cycles and 2 eliptical trainers, and about 4 other machine stations.  All equipment is Technogym which are quality machines.  From a food point of view the breakfasts are quite good.  I have twice had lunch there due to me using their conference facilities and both times I did not enjoy the food,  the conference facilities and tea/snacks though are top notch.  Have never had dinner there so cannot
title: My Favourite business hotel in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Great hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stayed at the Sankara for a week when I first moved to Nairobi, while searching for a more permanent place to live. The rooms are laid out nicely and the beds are simply divine. Water in the hotel is filtered so you can brush your teeth without worry, and the many restaurants located on the property give you a lot of options without having to leave the hotel. The rooftop pool is beautiful and turns into a trendy place to spend an evening later in the day. I highly recommend this hotel.
title: Top Class!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Only spent 1 night at the hotel but the experience was fabulous from start to finish. The staff are excellent, friendly and very willing to help.  The room was as expected for a five star with fresh fruit in the room on arrival and the room was immaculate.  We dined at the Artisan restaurant and opted for the buffet as they were so many choices available for all courses.  Breakfast was a buffet as well and again so many choices.  Lovely touch with the soap stone animal and card that is left when housekeeping turns down bed at night.
title: Comfortable and elegant, with excellent service

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I like luxury and a lot of traveling but me being a local, Sankara was just the best bday gift i could have ever given my beautiful lovely girl. a night spent there was well spent with flowers on the door step on entry. i would not think i would go anywhere else than there. big beg,good atmosphere,good shower.they call themselves 5 star, how about i say 5 and a half
title: Birthday

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Stayed while on business, room was great, clean, big soft bed withs lots of pillows. Wi-Fi was a touch slow and one night non-existent which when your trying to catch emails was a pain. Rooftop pool bar was ok and staff always available menu was a bit limited though. Breakfast has everything you'd want in a buffet.  Happily stay there again.
title: Sankara in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: During our stay the food was consistently delicious and presented very well. The managers of both the patio bar and hotel restaurant personally greeted us each meal and the staff tended to our every need, with a smile. John and Joshua are both very good chefs and both very nice; if you have any questions about their food they will be happy to sit with you and talk when they have time. The food in this hotel is some of the best I have had in Kenya and I have traveled through this country for the last 5 months.  Overall, the staff at this hotel are friendly, helpful and welcoming. It's a throwback to a time when people cared about their customers.
title: Fantastic service, great food and very nice rooms.

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I was given 24 hours notice to go to Nairobi on business. My assistant found this hotel, which was an unknown entity. Upon arrival, I was greeted into a clean, modern and welcoming reception. Check-in was quick, and Esther the receptionist was constantly smiling and eager to complete the process with the minimum of fuss. (Great after a long flight.) The rooms are spotlessly clean and well equipped, service in the bar and restaurant faultless, the food excellent and in general the whole stay, perfect. However, the biggest plus side to this hotel, is the staff. Always smiling, polite, happy to help and a great sense of pride in their job. If travelling to Nairobi on business, there really is, no other option.
title: No other option

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: it is located in wetlands and so close to shopping malls. The staff are great and the delicacies are perfectly prepared to leave you cleaving for more,honestly it a lovely place to visit My first stay at this hotel in East Africa & what a fantastic upbeat vibrant energy this place has! The staff was amazing and always smiling. They are professional, positive and have a very professional demeanor. The roof top bar is done very well and a must see. The hotel is like an upscale European modern hotel.
title: nice sankara

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: So far I stayed in: Hilton (never again), Stanley (good quality, colonial style),  Intercontinental (not a 5* hotel) and Sankara. I also used Southern Sun amenities of  Southern Sun, which I found to have a good quality (will try the hotel in the future).  Sankara: - great, modern decorated rooms (check pictures) - nice restaurant (1st floor) - nice bar/pool and in the evening disco (roof top) - free internet  On the negative side, I have two comments: -  the rooms I staid in, was separated by the next one, through a door. Which means, you can hear if that guy is snoring, watching TV, taking a shower or having fun activities. Not necessary the kind of situation you'd expect from a 5* hotel.  -  prices are very high, but since the hotel is new and almost all the time full, they
title: The best, I stayed so far, in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Made a work trip as much pleasure as business.

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I was here on business in late January for about a week. My stay was absoluteley lovely at this hotel. The rooftop bar was a great place to unwind after a long day with a drink, good food, and some nights there even music! Folks from outside the hotel come to the roof just to have a good time, apparently. But it's very safe as you need a room key to get ot any of the other floors. Rooms were clean, service infallibly polite and helpful. Loved it here. A little oasis in a busy part of the city.
title: Great Hotel with Special Little Souvenier Every Day

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stay in this hotel for almost a week when I attending a UN Conference in Nairobi. It was a pleasant hotel with good service. The breakfast is superb with both western & African cuisine. I was told they serve halal food before but not anymore during my stay. But, the best thing about this hotel which I will remember most is the tiny little souvenir they left at your bedside everyday. It was miniature of animals which nicely crafted. I have almost the entire collection which I think was the most valuable souvenir I will ever had from a hotel room
title: One of the vest business hotels in Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Ok, so the biggest factor in choosing a hotel in Nairobi is location to avoid traffic, but assuming Westlands is good for you, this is a great choice. Lives up to all standards of an international 5star hotel chain. Food is very good.
title: Very good hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: By far the best value in Nairobi.  All rooms have soothing decor, exquisite finishing touches, baths and comfortable beds with thick mattress pads. Like sleeping on a cloud.  The three restaurants offer a variety of cuisine from Asian to Continental. The hotel staff are endlessly accommodating and professional. Even its state-of-the-art gym is equipped with trainers who will whip you in shape if you'd like.  Instead of tourists you may bump into high-ranking diplomats, business execs and politicians at the sleek and chic champagne bar on the roof top.   The Angsana spa (owned by Banyan Tree) makes the Sankara the kind of five star hotel you might find in Bangkok.  The location in the suburb of Westlands is ideal, just 15 minutes from downtown Nairobi, and 20 minutes from the
title: The Oriental Hotel of Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: wonderful hotel, great staff, excellent location

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Sankara is in Westlands, a new suburb of Nairobi about 15 minutes drive from the busy city center and very close to the diplomatic enclave so most of the area is secure, well maintained with lovely gardens and modern architecture. The room we had was not huge but adequately spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the bathrooms clean and well designed with a separate shower closet and a tub. Sankara is a newer hotel while Fairmont Norfolk is an old style colonial building. We chose Sankara because we wanted a newer hotel with updated rooms and we were not disappointed. The gym is a good size with treadmills and weights and other basic equipment. I didn't have time to use the spa but a couple of people said it was great. 20% off for residents. The roof top terrace has events
title: Amazing!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Nice clean hotel with terrible room service

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: My first stay at this hotel in East Africa & what a fantastic upbeat vibrant energy this place has! The staff was amazing and always smiling. They are professional, positive and have a very professional demeanor. The roof top bar is done very well and a must see. The hotel is like an upscale European modern hotel. The breakfast is fresh, delicious and has many different varieties of fruits, ethnic breakfast as well as Meats and cheeses.  Overall very happy and blown off by service. Only thing is I wish they had better rates for staying more than 3 days cause I would have stayed longer! A must stay experience for any one visiting Nairobi.
title: Chef Joshua

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: We stayed only one short night in this hotel, transitioning from Uganda (gorilla trekking) to the Masi Mara in Kenya.  So, after a long day of travel including bumpy roads, small plane, big plane and 1.5hrs in Nairobi traffic!, we arrived around 6:30pm and were thrilled to be in a modern city hotel, with Wifi, a gym, great food, etc!  The rooms were well equipped, had super comfortable King-sized beds and one of the best showers I'd had in weeks!  The gym, although somewhat small, was very welcome to us and we enjoyed having it to use. We ordered room service for dinner and the food was delicious! The Breakfast buffet was amazing and we could recommend this hotel to anyone!
title: Wonderful modern hotel......nice break from Camps!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Sankara is a wonderful place, Wonderful food and Wonderful People.  I was among the first clients just 4 days after it was opened...i have since been a repeat guest and never have i been disappointed. Thank you Sankara. Keep it up.
title: WONDERFUL

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This hotel is pricey but worth every dollar. From the professional staff to top notch food. Everything is the best! Rooms are modern , big and very well appointed. I've stayed at a lot of hotels in my travels. This is what a hotel should be like Bravo Sankara Nairobi
title: The Best ..I want to live here

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I spent two nights for business at this hotel on 9th - 11th September 2014.  I thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel. We scheduled most of our engagements to be at the hotel - traffic in Nairobi is an utter nightmare. We loved the ability to use the clubhouse for our meetings with guest.  Dinner was equally held in a very relaxed environment in the main restaurant.  The hotel is a bit pricey - however, everything felt relatively new, ambiance was great, service awesome and the quality of food reasonably good.  I loved being invited to try out "Apple Crumble Pie" Tea. I recommend being adventurous trying our various Kenyan tea combinations. It's fun, taste great and an adventure for your senses.  Will definitely recommend the hotel for both business and leisure travelers.
title: Well worth a visit

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Great hotel, a little pricy, but you pay for the quality.   Friendly staff, food is exquisite.   Internet is a little slow, which forces you not to be in your room working.   Stayed 5 times this year.   The hotel is well located to Westlands area.   Great gym too.
title: Great hotel

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I have stayed at the Sankara on a few occasions and it is a very comfortable hotel for business.  I recommend it for a business hotel and it has a wonderful bar on the roof top of the hotel and a superb gym.
title: Comfortable

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I love this hotel from the minute I pulled up to the front door, The minimalistic lobby African contemporary art very up market pool side lounge, makes this is my new favorite Nairobi hotel. Make sure you check out the champagne bar
title: New York chic

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I had the pleasure of staying at Sankara Nairobi for the first time and this was a great decision I must say. I have stayed at other hotels before and Sankara was one of the very best stays I had. The frontline staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms were extremely clean and of the highest standard. Good options for dinner for those late nights when I could not go eat outside the hotel. I definitely be staying there again on my next trip. Bafana Kubheka - Business Traveller
title: Recent stay at Sankara Nairobi

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I recently spent 4 nights in the Sankara on a business trip to Nairobi and have to say the hotel was superb. Check in was quick and efficient, room was good (6th floor) and nice and clean. The whole hotel was very well furnished and had a pleasant environment and feel to it. In a great area of the city. The roof top pool bar is extremely nice to have a few drinks at. The main restaurants food at breakfast, lunch and dinner was good with an excellent variety. The Artisan bar is very relaxed with some of the best bar staff i have encountered. But the best thing about the hotel was the staff. Always smiling, happy, glad to chat and have some fun and look after you. From the security guys outside to the cleaners - all were bright and happy! Myself and my colleagues stay in Nairobi a
title: Brilliant!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: High Tea fail

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: Have frequented this hotel several times now and have always had a pleasant stay. On this occasion it must be noted the poor service, rooms in bad shape, showers rusty, food quality has dropped, dirty towels! Overpriced and not worth it!! Management should d pull up the socks
title: Convenient location but appalling service

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I travel extensively for work across Europe, Middle East and Africa and the Sankara is one of my favourite hotels. It is new and modern, however, it is the personal touch that makes the difference. The staff and service is superb, and even after a long absence everyone from the bell hops to the instructors in the gym greet me by name and welcome me home.  Ok, so I have to admit that I have stayed there 18 times over the past 2 years, sometimes for 10 days at a time. However, the personal service started from my first return trip.
title: Superb Hotel in Nairobi for Business Travellers

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This was the fifth stay at this hotel in 3 years.  It is always a welcome stop before or after safari. Previous visits at the hotel were superb and services were up to the expected standards.  But this time around, it was a disaster.  Upon arrival in our little muddy car after safari, we were quickly asked to take it to the parking lot and carry our luggage from there. We were almost first in line but other people who came after us were served first, and did not get an explanation why we were skipped in service.  The room we were allocated had a baby cot and we had not requested for one. This must have been a mix-up with a previous stay at the hotel when we traveled with kids. The guest relations staff were quick to note and changed us to another room and and even if there were
title: Nice Hotel but service level --

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
title: Chic but Over rated

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: My husband and I decided to sample the Sankara in a modest way. A sundowner at the topmost level of the hotel. Excellent barman who had an interesting charm of convincing us to cocktails. I must admit that the juices used were extremely fresh and the view was awesome.  With all the extravagant decor, I would have thought that the attire of the staff could have been designed using original ideas and themes. Not impressed with the service as the staff were not welcoming. Staff who gather up and chat amongst themselves is not my idea of great service.  The hustle and bustle does take the charm away. Nor for the critics....
title: very chic!

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: This was my first time at the Sankara Hotel. The Lobby is well appointed, airy, welcoming and pretty. The check-in process was performed at a slow and unhurried pace, nice and relaxing when checking in but the same action causes anxiety when checking out to catch a flight!  The rooms were gorgeous! The bed enveloped you and made you want to stay and ignore the rest of the world. Room service was prompt but the food was not hot. The bathrooms were clean, the amenities were nice.   I travelled out of Nairobi for a couple of days; I switched my original booking to stay at the Sankara for an overnight stay in Nairobi to catch the flight back home.  Will return.
title: Wonderful

hotel: Sankara Nairobi, Autograph Collection by Marriott
review: I stayed at the Sankara Hotel in August this year (2014) for 2 weeks.
